H0.text: Cratons are the ancient cores of continents where the earliest continental crust is now found.

H1.text: Craters are the ancient cores of continents where the earliest continental crust is now found.

H2.text: Escarpments are the ancient cores of continents where the earliest continental crust is now found.

H3.text: Mantles are the ancient cores of continents, where the earliest continental crust is now found.

A4.text: Scott King (2005) define the Archaean cratons as 'relatively flat, stable regions of the crust that have remained undeformed since the Precambrian, forming the ancient cores of the continents.'

A5.text: Cratons contain the oldest continental crust rocks on Earth.
